rdf:Description.dc:title: Freddo a Napoli
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Calvino, Italo
rdf:Description.dc:subject: the city of Naples
rdf:Description.dc:description: At first Naples is considered by the author and his group as the stereotype of a popular and pictoresque city, seen through the lens of film and literary representation, but is subsequently discovered as a place of real and harsh misery, where people inhabiting the poorest neighborhoods strive everyday for survival. Those people don't hide their condition, but they endure it with dignity and respect the ones in similar situations. Regardless of this, they get pretty angry at tourists passing-by to pitily sightsee their poverty.
